article:
This is a detailed listing of human spaceflights from 1981 to 1990, spanning the
end of the Soviet Union's Salyut space station program, the beginning of Mir,
and the start of the US Space Shuttle program.

* Red indicates fatalities. * Green indicates suborbital flights (including
flights that failed to attain intended orbit). {| class="wikitable" rules="all"
style="margin:auto; border:#555; text-align:center;"

|  Fullerton
|colspan=2 | 22 March 1982 STS-3, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
|colspan=2 | 30 March 1982 STS-3, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
| style="text-align:left;"|Further system testing. Miscellaneous scientific

| Salyut 7. Deployment of radio communications satellite. -

|colspan=2 | 27 June 1982 STS-4, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
|colspan=2 | 4 July 1982 STS-4, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
| style="text-align:left;"|Final space shuttle R&D flight. Miscellaneous
| scientific experiments plus classified US Air Force payload. -

| (Savitskaya). -

|  style="padding-left:0.5em; text-align:left;"| Vance D. Brand Robert F.

|colspan=2 | 11 November 1982 STS-5, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
|colspan=2 | 16 November 1982 STS-5, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
| style="text-align:left;"|Launched commercial ANIK C-3 and SBS-C communications
| satellites. Planned EVA cancelled due to space suit malfunction. -
! 91
|  style="padding-left:0.5em; text-align:left;"| Paul J. Weitz Karol J.
|  Bobko Donald H. Peterson F. Story Musgrave
|colspan=2 | 4 April 1983 STS-6, [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
|colspan=2 | 9 April 1983 STS-6, [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
| style="text-align:left;"|First Space Shuttle EVA (Peterson and Musgrave).
| Deployment of first Tracking and Data Relay Satellite (TDRS-1). Miscellaneous
| science experiments. -

|  Strekalov Aleksandr Serebrov
|colspan=2 | 20 April 1983 Soyuz T-8 |colspan=2 | 22 April 1983 Soyuz
T-8
| style="text-align:left;"|Failed to dock with Salyut 7. -

|  H. Hauck John M. Fabian Sally K. Ride Norman E. Thagard
|colspan=2 | 18 June 1983 STS-7, [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
|colspan=2 | 24 June 1983 STS-7, [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
| style="text-align:left;"|Two communications satellites launched. First
| American woman in space (Ride). Investigation into behavior of ant colony in
| zero gravity. Various microgravity experiments. -

|  style="padding-left:0.5em; text-align:left;"| Vladimir Lyakhov Aleksandr
|  Aleksandrov 26 June 1983 Soyuz T-9
|colspan=2 | Salyut 7
| 23 November 1983 Soyuz T-9 style="text-align:left;"| -

|  style="padding-left:0.5em; text-align:left;"| Richard H. Truly Daniel C.
|  Brandenstein Dale A. Gardner Guion Bluford William E. Thornton
|colspan=2 | 30 August 1983 STS-8, [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
|colspan=2 | 5 September 1983 STS-8, [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
| style="text-align:left;"|First African-American in space (Bluford). First
| night launch and landing. Deployed INSAT-1B satellite for India. Observation
| of behavior of rats in space.

|  Ulf Merbold
|colspan=2 | 28 November 1983 STS-9, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
|colspan=2 | 8 December 1983 STS-9, [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]
| style="text-align:left;"|First Spacelab (orbital laboratory) mission. First
| ESA astronaut, first West German astronaut and first non-American on US flight
| (Merbold). -

|  style="padding-left:0.5em; text-align:left;"| Vance D. Brand Robert L.
|  Gibson Bruce McCandless II Ronald E. McNair Robert L. Stewart

Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
| style="text-align:left;"|First untethered spacewalk (McCandless and Stewart).
| WESTAR-VI and PALAPA-B2 satellites deployed but failed to attain correct
| orbits. -

| style="text-align:left;"|Testing of experimental solar arrays. Three

Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]
| style="text-align:left;"|ERBS satellite deployed. Radar imaging. First EVA by

| style="text-align:left;"|Second Spacelab mission; microgravity experiments.

| Miscellaneous scientific experiments. First Saudi and the first Arab in space

| style="text-align:left;"|Three communications satellites deployed. Retrieval,

| style="text-align:left;"|Deployment of communications satellite. Miscellaneous

|colspan=4 | 28 January 1986 STS-51-L, [[Space Shuttle
Challenger|Challenger]]
| style="text-align:left;"|Disintegrated 73 seconds after launch with loss of
